fullText: Donald Margulies's new play is a thoughtful meditation on family, art and mortality, even if it doesn't always achieve the emotional depths it reaches for.
dtliExcerpt: Donald Margulies's new play is a thoughtful meditation on family, art and mortality, even if it doesn't always achieve the emotional depths it reaches for.
bwwExcerpt: If you're the kind of person who enjoys Chekhov but wishes it were more, you know, relatable--a kind of person who probably doesn't and certainly shouldn't exist-then The Country House is just the play for you. Donald Margulies's dozy family drama transplants Uncle Vanya to a cottage near the theater retreat of Williamstown, with modern jokes and bits of The Seagull patched in for variety...The essential banality of this bubbleless soap seems intended to be tempered by our inherent fascination with show business. The play depicts an insular and obsolescent theater world, and exemplifies it.
